p: All 27 patients sampled in this study exhibited compatible symptoms for CHIKV infection. Taken together, these findings corroborate to other studies that demonstrate that 70% of CHIKV infection cases are symptomatic, since the virus rate of attack is high [ 27– 28]. The difference of positive results between ELISA and RT-qPCR techniques is justified by the lack of time from the onset of symptoms and collection date performed, since the viremic peak–that would be detected by RT-qPCR–occurs in first days of infection [ 29, 23] unlike IgM antibodies levels that can be detected early as 5 days of infection up to 2 months [ 27, 29– 31].
